name: Brandon Antillon
summary: Software Engineer with several years of experience responsible for working with web applications both frontend and backend. Experienced in working in a fast-paced, collaborative software development environment with teams.

education.major: Bachelor of Science in Computer Information Technology
Master of Science in Software Engineering

positions.title: Senior Software Engineer
responsibilities: Decomposed monolithic application systems into micro-services, and contributed to company's micro-service architecture.
Architected CI/CD pipelines for our applications from development to deployment with Azure DevOps, AKS, and Azure Pipelines.
Worked extensively with Docker containerization and Kubernetes to deploy our next-generation applications and microservices.

Developed internal applications and supported other departments with both PHP/Lumen and NodeJS APIs. Categories include rebuilding our flight, hotel, car, and other travel related reservation systems.

positions.title: Software Engineer
responsibilities: Contributed to the development of an api dedicated to searching/booking flights, now currently in use for Wells Fargo's loyalty points system using Laravel/Lumen.
Aided in the development of the front-end for Wells Fargo loyalty points system, as well as front-end clients for other smaller clients like PNC and Harvard Rewards Alumni card.
Worked with a team in an agile envionment, and used task tracking tools like Jira, Confluence for documentation, and Git for version control.
Worked on transaction monitoring systems using NodeJS back-end, MongoDB, and React front-end.

positions.title: Full Stack Developer
responsibilities: Collaborated with one other developer in an Agile environment to create, deploy and support an in-house ERP system written in PHP that 80+ users access every day.
Used source control to manage code changes, and branches.
Developed successor to old ERP system with one other developer. ERP system takes care of things like timesheets, company projects, employee management, and much more.
Also in charge of fixing bugs within the ERP system, and consistently reported back to superiors about fixed issues.
Communicated with staff and management to convert their requirements into code and features for the new ERP system.
Other developer and I are the sole maintainers of the application, therefore we're the main points of contact whenever an issue arises.
Used Vagrant/Ubuntu as a main development environment.

positions.title: Junior DevOps Engineer
responsibilities: Work with a development team in an Agile environment fixing bugs and implementing new features into the main product (a credit card processing web application).
Extensively use source-control (Git) to manage code changes.
Set up a sandbox environment comprised of Linux VMs with web servers, databases, load balancers, and other services that are successfully being used for product testing and prototyping.
Quickly eliminated any assigned bugs ranging from backend PHP bugs to frontend JavaScript and UI bugs.
Improved developer workflow by successfully implementing Vagrant virtual machines for use on developer local machines that mimic the production environment.
Developed several tools for the company including a REST API that allows LDAP authentication between in-house applications and the central LDAP server.

positions.title: Student Assistant Developer
responsibilities: Created web applications with a software development team in an Agile oriented environment.
Technical environment included Laravel (PHP framework), JavaScript, HTML and CSS.
Worked with Test Driven Development using Codeception for PHP, and extensively used source-control to keep track of projects.
Developed a Faculty Finder system, with the development team, for students to easily locate professors, classes, office hours, and other relevant information.
Developed an application that facilitates students to submit homework and for professors to confirm homework and assign grades.

Participated in automating the deployment process of virtual machines for testing; employed Cobbler and Ansible to expedite the process and ensure consistency when creating Testing, Staging and Production environments.
